org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch

Enum StepSizeInitializationMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<StepSizeInitializationMethod>
      • org.platanios.learn.optimization.linesearch.StepSizeInitializationMethod
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<StepSizeInitializationMethod>

    public enum StepSizeInitializationMethod
extends java.lang.Enum<StepSizeInitializationMethod>
    An enumeration of all possible step size initialization methods, used for computing the initial step size value for iterative line search algorithms, that are currently supported by our implementation. For methods that do not produce well scaled search directions, such as the steepest descent and conjugate gradient methods, it is important to use current information about the problem and the algorithm to make the initial guess. For Newton and quasi-Newton methods, the UNIT step size initialization method should always be selected. This choice ensures that unit step lengths are taken whenever they satisfy the termination conditions and allows the rapid rate of convergence properties of these methods to take effect.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      CONSERVE_FIRST_ORDER_CHANGE
      Computes a value for the initial step size (used by iterative line search algorithms) by assuming that the first order change in the objective function at the current iterate/point will be the same as the one obtained in the previous step.
      CONSTANT
      Initializes the step size to a provided constant value.
      MODIFIED_QUADRATIC_INTERPOLATION
      Computes a value for the initial step size (used by iterative line search algorithms) by setting it to equal to the minimum between 1 and 1.01 times the minimizer of a quadratic interpolation to the current data: the objective function value at the current iterate/point, the objective function value at the previous iterate/point, the objective function gradient at the previous iterate/point and the previous direction used by the algorithm.
      QUADRATIC_INTERPOLATION
      Computes a value for the initial step size (used by iterative line search algorithms) by setting it to equal to the minimizer of a quadratic interpolation to the current data: the objective function value at the current iterate/point, the objective function value at the previous iterate/point, the objective function gradient at the previous iterate/point and the previous direction used by the algorithm.
      UNIT
      Initializes the step size to the constant value 1.

        public static final StepSizeInitializationMethod CONSERVE_FIRST_ORDER_CHANGE
        Computes a value for the initial step size (used by iterative line search algorithms) by assuming that the first order change in the objective function at the current iterate/point will be the same as the one obtained in the previous step.

      • QUADRATIC_INTERPOLATION

        public static final StepSizeInitializationMethod QUADRATIC_INTERPOLATION
        Computes a value for the initial step size (used by iterative line search algorithms) by setting it to equal to the minimizer of a quadratic interpolation to the current data: the objective function value at the current iterate/point, the objective function value at the previous iterate/point, the objective function gradient at the previous iterate/point and the previous direction used by the algorithm.

      • MODIFIED_QUADRATIC_INTERPOLATION

        public static final StepSizeInitializationMethod MODIFIED_QUADRATIC_INTERPOLATION
        Computes a value for the initial step size (used by iterative line search algorithms) by setting it to equal to the minimum between 1 and 1.01 times the minimizer of a quadratic interpolation to the current data: the objective function value at the current iterate/point, the objective function value at the previous iterate/point, the objective function gradient at the previous iterate/point and the previous direction used by the algorithm.

      • computeInitialStepSize

        public abstract double computeInitialStepSize(AbstractFunction objective,
                                              Vector point,
                                              Vector direction,
                                              Vector previousPoint,
                                              Vector previousDirection,
                                              double initialStepSize,
                                              double previousStepSize)
        Computes the initial step size using the selected method and the available data.
        Parameters:
        objective - The objective function of the optimization problem.
        point - The current iterate/point.
        direction - The current direction selected by the optimization algorithm.
        previousPoint - The iterate/point of the previous iteration.
        previousDirection - The direction used by the optimization algorithm in the previous iteration.
        initialStepSize - The initial step size value chosen by the user (if there is one - otherwise the method selected should not be CONSTANT. If the method selected is not CONSTANT then this value is ignored.
        previousStepSize - The step size used by the optimization algorithm in the previous iterations.
        Returns:
        A value for the initial step size, to be used by iterative line search algorithms.
